availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, butcher. Native of Germany. Married to Mary Jane "Jennie" Rollins Brucker in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on February 27, 1860. Father of James Brucker and Frank J. Brucker. Butcher in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1858. Butcher in Louisville in 1859. Butcher in Louisville in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 120, p. 338A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482708.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Jefferson County, KY, June 1863, p. 37.
"Frank J. Brucker," Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 20659.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 9, Jefferson County, Kentucky, 1863, p. 105.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 11, Jefferson County, Kentucky, 1863.
"Foot Race," Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, KY), June 17, 1858, p. 2.
"The Foot Race in Butchertown," Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, KY), June 18, 1858, p. 2.
"Grand Banquet and Ball," Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, KY), February 22, 1859, p. 3.
The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), February 2, 1865, p. 3.
